intro: Rhinopteryx angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rhinoceros plant, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are typically followed by bright red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
